author: BygPhattyPlus

text: Extremely not balanced in inferno. I'm not one of those crying about difficulty, but rather balance in a specific manner. It's not about me able or not to complete it by myself / with frds. But rather the relative difficulty for different classes as well as viable builds in inferno is so extremely limited it's ridiculous. And no, even the word difficulty is presented poorly, every single creep 2 hits u = difficulty. There's no tactical advancements. Bosses are ez, mobs are impossible.

author: 7md

text: Not to spoil my fun, but what's left of Tristam now, SupraDarky? Could you describe it in your own words? Back in D1, it was a barely habitable settlement with a drunkard and a sarcastic orphan, and in D2, the gruff old blacksmith you once knew was recruited by Diablo's hordes. Surely there must be nothing but abandoned foundations now...

text: Oh, God....that intro guitar. So many memories. And I haven't gotten Diablo 3 yet.

author: gentleuterus

text: I'm very impressed with the game - I feel like the sound design overall is much better in Diablo III. As for the music, I feel like the songs themselves aren't as good in isolation, but that within the context of the game they are far moodier and set the tone incredibly well. And like you said, the skill system has turned out incredibly well.

author: KF-Sigurd

text:
Having the most fun with the Barbarian right now. My Diablo skills are a little rusty, so playing someone who just jumps into battle and smashes stuff is a nice way to get used to it again.

But yeah, loving the music in New Tristram. Really eery.
author: Broseph Stalin

text: It sounds really great :)
author: qap

text: Anyone else completely addicted to this game right now? I'm loving my Witch Doctor. I love how many different and balanced playstyles there are for each class; I have yet to play with a WD that uses the same set of skills I do. I'll probably finish Normal mode solo and then group for the higher difficulties. Anyways, Tristram's theme is still king but I'm very impressed by New Tristram and D3's music in general. Brower did a fine job here, he obviously tried sticking to Uelmen's style.
author: SupraDarky
